metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5986 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the sctp_wait_for_sndbuf function in net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernel before 4.9.11 allows local users to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and panic) via a multithreaded application that peels off an association in a certain buffer-full state. Alexander Popov discovered that a race condition existed in the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5986` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-117-generic - 3.13.0-117.164
